title: Previously harmless Google API keys now expose Gemini AI data
summary: Google API keys for services like Maps embedded in accessible client-side code could be used to authenticate to the Gemini AI assistant and access private data. [...]

title: Trend Micro warns of critical Apex One code execution flaws
summary: Trend Micro has patched two critical Apex One vulnerabilities that allow attackers to gain remote code execution (RCE) on vulnerable Windows systems. [...]

title: European DYI chain ManoMano data breach impacts 38 million customers
summary: DIY store chain ManoMano is notifying customers of a data breach personal data, which was caused by hackers compromising a third-party service provider. [...]

title: Critical Juniper Networks PTX flaw allows full router takeover
summary: A critical vulnerability in the Junos OS Evolved network operating system running on PTX Series routers from Juniper Networks could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute code remotely with root privileges. [...]

title: Olympique Marseille confirms 'attempted' cyberattack after data leak
summary: French professional football club Olympique de Marseille has confirmed a cyberattack after a threat actor claimed on Monday that it breached the club's systems earlier this month. [...]

title: Ransomware payment rate drops to record low as attacks surge
summary: The number of ransomware victims paying threat actors has dropped to 28% last year, an all-time low, despite a significant increase in the number of claimed attacks. [...]

title: Microsoft expands Windows restore to more enterprise devices
summary: Microsoft now allows more enterprise users to restore their personal settings and Microsoft Store apps from a previous Windows 11 device. [...]

title: New York sues Valve for promoting illegal gambling via game loot boxes
summary: New York Attorney General Letitia James sued video game developer and publisher Valve Corporation for using game loot boxes to facilitate illegal gambling activities among children and teenagers. [...]
